reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling up of interventions to combat tuberculosis in Côte d’Ivoire

description.narrative: Côte d'Ivoire - Tuberculosis - Alliance Nationale pour la Santé et le Développement en Côte D'Ivoire - Alliance Côte d'Ivoire. This program has the following goals: Reduce the mortality rate due to TB by 20 percent between 2015 and 2020.. The objectives of this program are: Increase case notification of new and relapse cases from 21,357 in 2016 to 22,795 in 2020. By 2020 (2019 cohort) achieve a treatment success rate of 87 percent among new and relapse cases. Increase the proportion of TB patients tested for HIV from 98 percent in 2016 to 100 percent from 2018 and the proportion of TB/HIV patients treated with ART from 90 percent in 2015 to 100 percent by 2018. Increase the treatment success rate among those treated for multidrug-resistant TB (MDR-TB) from 81 percent in 2015 to 86 percent by 2020. Improve and strengthen the NTCP’s technical, management and coordination capacities

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for CIV-T-ACI
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners

DOTS-other 2: Number and percentage of notified cases of all forms of TB-(i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed) (new and relapse) followed up by the community around the existing TB TCs/CDTs
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals

DOTS-other 1: Number and percentage of notified cases of all forms of TB-(i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed) (new and relapse) referred by the community (CHWs and CC) to existing TB TCs/CDTs for diagnosis among all cases notified at national level
TB/HIV-other 1: Percentage of HIV positive patients having been screened for TB by community counselors during HIV supportive activities
TCP-Other 2: Percentage of patients lost to follow-up (new cases and relapses) among thoseinitiated on treatment

TCP-Other 1: Number and Percentage of tuberculosis cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed and clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cure and treatment completed) of all cases followed up by community health workers, new cases and relapse
DOTS-other 4: Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Impact indicator for CIV-T-ACI
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB I-other 1: RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Outcome indicator for CIV-T-ACI
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse

Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases - Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB⃰ as a proportion of the estimated number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases among notified TB cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases

TB O-other 1: Treatment success rate of MDR-TB: Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed drug resistant TB cases (RR-TB and/or MDR-TB) successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among those enrolled on second-line anti-TB treatment during the year of assessment
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
